website_summaries.verdict: Easy to install and easy to use, this is the very best faucet on the market.
cons: Rare reports of leaks and defective sensors

website_summaries.verdict: There are three ways to turn the water on, making the convenience worth the extra cost.
pros: Easy to install and use, it works on either batteries or a plug-in adapter, and you can turn on the water via the handle or 1 of 2 separate sensors
cons: The bottom sensor can seem short at 3 seconds, and sometimes you get splashed reaching across the sink

customer_reviews.title: Went from 5 star to 1 star. After owning ...
customer_reviews.text: Went from 5 star to 1 star. After owning it for almost two years it has developed two leaks in two different areas. One is on the hose itself, the other is a non-replaceable hose. I'm furious that I trusted Moen to keep my kitchen island from developing water damage. I wish there was a lemon law that would force them to buy it back because why would I want them to replace parts that will fail again?!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super frustrating! Has anyone else ever experienced this
customer_reviews.text: We've had our faucet for only a few months and it has started turning itself on randomly. sometimes it runs for only a few seconds, other times it's a couple of minutes. once it starts there's no way to turn it off. we tried pulling the batteries, but it still runs. once it turns off we can pull the batteries but then it won't work even manually. At first we thought it might be interference from radio waves in motion sensor lights but now it even does it during the day. Super frustrating! Has anyone else ever experienced this?
customer_reviews.author: Terry H.

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed!!
customer_reviews.text: After less than 3 years my Moen 7594SRS fixture's flex hose split. Needless to say it caused quite a mess. I paid $300.00 for this faucet and I am shocked to have such a problem after only 3 years. Ironically my next door neighbor bought a similar Moen product and he had the same problem. I really expected more from a Moen product! Very disappointed!!!! Never again.
customer_reviews.author: Florida Grandpa

customer_reviews.title: After two years of use, I have had to ...
customer_reviews.text: After two years of use, I have had to tighten the cartridge nut three times. You will know when it's loose because it will leak from under the handle. Inserting the allen wrench into the handle to remove it is much harder than it should be. The gasket provided for the hole in the sink appears to be made from polyethylene, which is too slippery. Even when tightening the faucet to the sink as tight as I dare (porcelain sink) the faucet will still move around. If the gasket was silicone or epdm, it would have more grip and be able to keep the faucet from moving.The finish is holding up reasonably well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor Water Flow.
customer_reviews.text: I've now had this installed for 7+ months, long enough to feel this was a bad choice. Because of the way the unit both filters and regulates water flow (a mixing valve box below the sink), regardless of how often I clean the in-line filters, water pressure from the faucet is inadequate. Today I simply removed the filters/screens with little improvement. I need to now find a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Yanmarguy

customer_reviews.title: This looks nice and plain and simple
customer_reviews.text: This looks nice and plain and simple, and is easy to turn on / off without (dirty or meat handling) hands. However, it was very hard to get the nozzle back into the holder after extracting to spray. We have had it 2 months and the faucet dangles 1-2 inches down. when we try to force it back in, the curve of faucet separates from the base. I have tried pulling the hose from under the sink, but that does not help. I will have to get a new faucet AND pay for the plumber again.
customer_reviews.author: PB Chicago

customer_reviews.title: I would not recommend this product
customer_reviews.text: After following all instructions as per manual and installing this faucet there was no water flow. After connecting power supply sensor would blink for few second and there is no water flow. I tried to remove the power wait for 30 seconds connect power cord again waiting another 1 minute or so, still no luck. I tried doing this several time and this time I used the lever handle and there was water flow for 5 seconds and it stopped. I would not recommend this product. I wish there was a zero or minus rating
customer_reviews.author: AMAUSER

customer_reviews.title: If you want good water pressure DO NOT BUY THIS the motion sense ...
customer_reviews.text: This Faucet is junk.If you want good water pressure DO NOT BUY THIS the motion sense constantly has to be reset,Its a pain to have to constantly unplug it is a real pain in the butt.
customer_reviews.author: JF2015

customer_reviews.title: Happy with product
customer_reviews.text: Way better than my last faucet. Easy to install. Swivels left/right smoothly with very light pressure. Water control is precise. Water pressure is very good even without removing the in-line screen provided. In sprayer mode its quite powerful. Finish is aesthetically pleasing. The head that comes down is make of plastic with finish to match the rest of the metal parts. Wish it was made of metal because it feels kind of cheep but I can understand why its plastic, because it has to be light so the counter weight on the hose can retract it easily.
customer_reviews.author: Vitarelli

customer_reviews.title: Turns on by itself
customer_reviews.text: Not sure how a large company like Moen can sell an expensive item like this that suffers from this type of problem. I skipped using the battery pack on the faucet, because others said that was the reason it turns on itself, but that is not true. This faucet is not designed correctly. Of course the faucet functioned fine for the first five weeks, so the Amazon return window had closed.
customer_reviews.author: David L. Diller

customer_reviews.title: Skip the motion sensor
customer_reviews.text: Very attractive and works well. The motion sensor sounds like a convenient option, but turns on the faucet about 10 times that you don't want to for every time you do. You can turn it off, but my wife hasn't gotten as annoyed with it as I have.
customer_reviews.author: Dave E

customer_reviews.title: Don't trust this company!
customer_reviews.text: After this faucet had been installed for less than 6 months - by a licensed plumber - the top broke off. A lot of money and there was no warranty included with the product. When I notified the seller of this, they just blew me off so I have no recourse but to replace this at my own expense. A complete waste of a LOT of money. I will only buy something like this locally from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Sojourner

customer_reviews.title: Best Kitchen Faucet
customer_reviews.text: We replaced an 11 year old kitchen sink faucet with an $80 “Project Source” faucet we found at Lowe’s. It was rated at 1.8 GPM but hardly had any pressure, looked good but no performance. I just installed this moen (1.5 GPM) in matte black and the performance difference is night and day. This has 10x more flow and pressure than Lowe’s go to arc faucet. The power flow is crazy awesome, my only negative is once it’s engaged you have to shut off water flow to return to regular. Should have bought this moen to start with. The Goodwill is getting my old faucet which is less than a year old. Also not a plumber easy install!
customer_reviews.author: tct2

customer_reviews.title: A Solid Investment
customer_reviews.text: Everything about this product screams quality. At first I shopped the hands free models, and after reading the reviews decided to remain trouble free with manual control. Easy on off and temperature adjustment with this model fits the bill. It was super easy to install with clear instructions. I expect it last for years to come
customer_reviews.author: Randy C

customer_reviews.title: So far it has been working well and the installation was simple.
customer_reviews.text: I installed the faucet according to the instructions that were provided with the Faucet. I also installed the plastic shield for the sprayer hose. (this is a seperate item that can be purchased from Wayfair and it is called a hose guide and cost about and costs about $ 23.88 with shipping and tax). At the time I couldn't find it at Amazon, however Amazon as of this writing can ship you the Moen 159060 Hose Guide for 16.99 If you're going to store anything below the sink, the shield is a must in order to guarantee that the hose weight will not snag on any of the plumbing under the sink. It is real easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: Tony C

customer_reviews.title: Love not having to get raw food on my faucet to turn it on!
customer_reviews.text: Having this touchless faucet in the kitchen is so liberating! Imagine having your hands full of gook and not having to touch anything to turn it on. There are a couple of downsides. It comes with a battery pack which you have to mount, and I'm assuming the more you use the sensor feature, the sooner you'll have to replace the batteries. You can have it hardwired, but you have to have an electrician to do that in addition to a plumber. Also the sensor to the left of the faucet gets unintentionally activated if you reach across under the faucet w/your left hand to turn the faucet on. Not a biggie, but just somewhat annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Demelza

customer_reviews.title: Very Good MotionSense however don't rely on the battery pack
customer_reviews.text: We really do love this faucet. We've had it for 6 months now without mechanical issues. Install was fairly easy, only complicated by garbage disposal in the way but we figured it out. I would say as of today we are on our third set of batteries in only 6 months, so purchasing the AC adapter now. Its just not worth losing the ability to turn it on a the most needed moments as it seems to happen. Especially once we ran out of batteries... It's totally worth the buy, but just get the AC adapter.
customer_reviews.author: MelK

customer_reviews.title: Low water pressure
customer_reviews.text: We really like the touch free feature in the faucet, and it looks so much nicer than our old one. But beware of the lower water pressure rating. We went from a 1.8 to 1.5 and thought it wouldn't be a huge difference, but it is! It will barely move food down the drain with the sprayer. I know wish I had my old one back on.
customer_reviews.author: Jaylene D. Howell

customer_reviews.title: DONT BUY
customer_reviews.text: Total lemon of a product! Moen will NOT replace and has weeks of back order for a part. They won't replace or give money back. They have their own number to push when you call in just for this motion sensor faucet. Not helpful at all!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 3 years is not enough
customer_reviews.text: After 3 years (seems to be the magic number with the other reviews I am now reading), my flex hose is also leaking causing a major mess under my sink. Like the other reviewers having the same problem, I expected WAY more from Moen and for the money spent on the faucet, I am livid that it only got 3 years use. I will never, ever purchase another moen product. Boo!
customer_reviews.author: Becky

customer_reviews.title: Very good faucet
customer_reviews.text: We installed this faucet on our kitchen sink in early 2016. It was an easy install and has performed flawlessly since. The finish is very easy to clean, resists scratches and the sprayer is excellent. Our only issue is the lack of markings to show hot and cold. Now that we've used it for 9 months, we've figured out that handle up is hot and handle horizontal is cold, but the handle's positioning is not intuitive. BTW - the faucet has never leaked a drop since new. When it shuts off, the water flow quits period.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Gorton

customer_reviews.title: Great Faucet - but
customer_reviews.text: My old Moen faucet was about 20 years old and rusting under the sink, so I ordered a new Moen. Later, I talked to a plumber who told me that Moen guarantees their faucets for lifetime and if I had contacted the company they would have sent me a new one without charge. Nuts, I didn't really have to pay for the replacement. Check with Moen if you are replacing one before you "buy" a new Moen replacement.
customer_reviews.author: The Vernier Scale

customer_reviews.title: Nope, don’t do it!  Get a Delta!
customer_reviews.text: Nope, don’t do it! Literally broke two days after the return date. Um...WHY? I would like a clarification as to why such an expensive item would break so easily and why you only give one month for the return?
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING FAUCET
customer_reviews.text: I love my new faucet, it works great compared to the one I purchased a few years ago that we ended up retuning, obviously they've made some improvements. I highly recommend you purchase the Moen 177565 AC adapters service kit. Without it the touchless part didn't work as well on the bottom, the water would shut off immediately because the batteries weren't strong enough for the water flow, but as soon as my husband installed the adapter, it worked like a champ. I was able to wash my hand without it shutting off until I moved my hand away from the sensor.
customer_reviews.author: Lil Miss Spoiled

customer_reviews.title: Useless Faucet Has a Mind of it's Own
customer_reviews.text: Purchased March 2019, Installed by licensed plumber July 2019. Faucet turns on by itself and runs without stopping and cannot be turned off with handle or sensor. It can only be turned off at the shutoff valve on the supply line. At other times, the faucet cannot be turned on by sensors or even manually using the handle. And at other times it turns itself on and off in short bursts. This faucet is not usable at all. We now have to leave the supply line valve closed so it doesn't turn itself on and run for hours while we're away. I have contacted Moen support by their online, "Contact Us," web page.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Defective electronics
customer_reviews.text: We purchased two of these faucets four months ago; one for a very small island sink and one for the main kitchen sink. The one for the island had a defective sensor and was immediately replaced. Great service! Now the kitchen sink has gone out. Understand that if the electronics go out you have no water. They can get us new electronics after Christmas. We will have 30 people here next week for Christmas dinner. I will think of them as I carry pots and pans to the bathtub to wash. Or I may just replace it with a cheap faucet that turns on and off when you need it.
customer_reviews.author: SunnieA

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: We love our new faucet. It is awesome for those times you have chicken or other meat or food items on your hands. If you haven't previously had an automatic faucet here are a few tips. The front sensor will initiate a short stream of water, so if you are working on something in the sink, move the faucet to the side or your outstretched arm will get soaked! The top sensor provides a steady stream of water for maybe 3 minutes. If you need continuous water for a longer period, use the manual lever on the side. It's a great product and well worth the money!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sharon J.

customer_reviews.title: It leaked within days, but it was repaired
customer_reviews.text: Cons: The faucet started to leak within days of installation. When I sent a photo showing the leak to the Moen customer service, they immediately diagnosed the leak as due to a bad cartridge and promptly sent me a replacement. It is about 10 days since we replaced the cartridge, and it has not leaked. (Just in case it does, I have placed a tray under the sink to catch any leak, though.) I appreciated Moen's quick response, but it left me wondering about Moen’s quality control—I don’t think a brand-new faucet should leak. Pros: The faucet is very easy to install. We did not have to hire a plumber to install it or replace the cartridge.
customer_reviews.author: K. M.

customer_reviews.title: No power no water
customer_reviews.text: First the motion detector is not great. The one on the base is not sensitive enough to keep the water on when your washing your hands and the one on top goes off too easily if you reach above the faucet. Secondly, the faucet will NOT work at all if the power goes out or the batteries die. So no power no water. Bad design flaw in my book. It was expensive but after having to deal with batteries during twice I think I’ll replace it.
customer_reviews.author: jpulsifer

customer_reviews.title: So good I had to buy another one for my mom's kitchen
customer_reviews.text: This has been a great faucet and I use the motion sense feature way more than expected. My mom liked it so much that I ended up buying another one to install in her kitchen. It only comes with a battery option, but you can buy an adapter to use it plugged in. I bought the adapter but then have to rewire some things under my sink to have a place to plug it in so I'm still using the batteries but that works with no problem.
customer_reviews.author: JS

customer_reviews.title: Died in less than 1 year
customer_reviews.text: It has been less than 1 year since I installed this expensive faucet, and the motion sensor on the top has stopped working. I am going to see if MOEN will do anything about it, but this is extremely frustrating. I will update the review if MOEN handles this issue well, but incredibly frustrating that this has happened. Update 1 - The part is on back order, my guess is that there are a lot of warranty claims on this sensor
customer_reviews.author: redskate

customer_reviews.title: Big Mistake!
customer_reviews.text: Aggravating dripping!! It was installed by a reputable plumber and he is in no way to be blamed for this. He told me to call Moen for a replacement cartridge which I did. I did not receive it so I had to call Moen again. My plumber came back a second time to do the replacement cartridge install. The water should stop completely when I turn it off. But it does not. It drips fairly quickly and then slows down to a drop that takes forever to form before finally making its way into the sink. Wish I hadn't bought this item.
customer_reviews.author: kitcat

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about this. So great not to have to touch the handle to turn the water on. The sensor near the base is useless though it turns off before you are done. But the one on the top works fine and I usually just use this sensor. Update 1/3/18 BE WARNED: If you kitchen happens to be an outside wall this faucet will not trickle for more than two hours. It automatically shuts off. If ever you're in a situation (like I have been this past week) where you need to trickle water to prevent pipes from freezing you will not be able to. I had to replace the faucet until I solve the pipe issue.
customer_reviews.author: mam

customer_reviews.title: Great faucet but...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great faucet! One thing I think it lacks against its competitors: the magnetic connect. I like the option between regular and spray - it also has the option of supercharging both. It still reconnects appropriately but I still dream: could this faucet be better? YES!! Magnetic reconnect is the only thing this lacks. FYI to Moen: put a simple magnet to to this model to blow the competition away. Sink turns hot/cold as needed and turns off when wanted. Supercharging only turns off when faucet turns off. Great feature but I feel improvements could be made on this model...
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this product.
customer_reviews.text: This is a piece or rubbish. Blue light started blinking. instructions that came with unit says open the battery compartment but no diagram nor description of where that is (was installed by plumber). Replaced with new tested batteries and the faucett does not work at all. Says that handle works even without current. A lie. No water whatsoever coming from faucett regardless of all efforts. Double checked batteries etc. Tried to call Moen. They are closed and I HAVE NO WATER IN MY KITCHEN. Please take this piece of very expensive junk back ($575).
customer_reviews.author: JBM

customer_reviews.title: Best faucet I have ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: Moving the handle is very smooth and effortless. The hose is covered with woven fabric so there is no drag when pulling the faucet out. (Unlike the plastic hosed ones that these replaced.) The faucet has a swivel head so the stream/spray can be directed at an angle which often eliminates the effort of having to bend a hose to direct a spray. The spray is very strong, and when you actuate the turbo button (or whatever they call it) the spray is fantastic! It has a beautiful finish and a lifetime warranty. I couldn't ask for more.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Very good looking and practical faucet.
customer_reviews.text: Had professionally installed so can't speak to the ease of installation, but I really like the features of this faucet. The spray is really strong and powerful and the ease and pull and retraction of the nozzle is great. Best feature is the power boost button to get extra power and water flow when desired. Lifetime warranty is also appreciated as the last one I had installed only had a 2-year guarantee and made it just past before failing.
customer_reviews.author: A. Pava

customer_reviews.title: Glitchie right off the bat...
customer_reviews.text: As of today, right after installing this beautiful faucet. I decided to do the dishes. After 15 mins, I went to turn it off via the motion sensor and it did not work. The faucet would not turn off. I had to manually turn it off. After 10 mins trying to figure out what happened, I proceeded to do a re-set on it. (Removing the power for 10 seconds). What the instructions do not tell you is that the faucet needs to be open before you give it power again, so it can go through it's cycles. So my wife proceeded to do the dishes after dinner and AGAIN the faucet would not turn off!!!
customer_reviews.author: Pichi3305

customer_reviews.title: Nice Looking Kitchen Facuet - Short Connection Hoses
customer_reviews.text: The only issue I had when installing was that the cold water line from the faucet was 1-1/4" too short to reach the cold water shut-off valve. I had to go to the hardware store and buy a 10" extension hose to make the connection. For $250.00 Moen could add a couple of inches to the length of their connector hoses or include a couple of hose extensions in the box.
customer_reviews.author: KaptSlo

customer_reviews.title: Not what I would have expected for Moen
customer_reviews.text: In fairness, I haven't actually used the faucet as yet.....just installing. I am hoping it works fine. What really disappoints me though is that the piece at the end of the faucet which you grab to spray, etc is PLASTIC! The rest of the faucet seems nice and I am happy with the color and look. The on/off handle seems solid. BUT the part that I anticipate grabbing and using often feels cheap and I really expected more from a name brand and the price!
customer_reviews.author: Neustel

customer_reviews.title: Moen 7594SRS Arbor
customer_reviews.text: This product was taken abroad for usage, but unfortunately, it did not serve the purpose for which it was purchased. The hose connected to the faucet was much too tiny to carry water flowing from water pipe adequately. The shower mouth cannot be pulled out to rinse as preferred. This product is not enjoyable without water pressure pump installed. As for beauty, it is, but what is the use of beauty if the product is not functioning as well as it should. Moreover, it didn't come with requisite adaptors. In which case, the buyer would have to source for the adaptors. This is not good enough. This product does not make for a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Monilola Olabode

customer_reviews.title: Hands Free Perfection!
customer_reviews.text: My first thought when shopping around was, Wow! Faucets are Expensive! But this one is worth every penny. I cook a lot, I mean a lot! I create Video Cooking Recipes on YouTube at KARENS SIZZLE AND SPICE and when I'm filming, I need the best equipment to make it as flawlesss as possible. It took me a few minutes to get used to the sensors but this faucet is really top notch. I would highly recommend. And it stays so clean! Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Karen L Boncela

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the expense.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as an addition to our kitchen renovation project. Easy instructions, no issues there. The “Motionsense” feature is worthless. This thing turns on and off WHENEVER IT WANTS!!! Tried disabling the sensors, no good. Tried resetting the sensors, no good. I didn’t even see a blue indicator light flashing anywhere. And what happens when I call customer service? CLOSED TILL MONDAY!!! Now I have to wait 2 days to talk to someone?!? Unreal. Never again.
customer_reviews.author: Hondo

customer_reviews.title: LOVE everything about this faucet
customer_reviews.text: We have this faucet in oil rubbed bronze in the kitchen and loved it so much even after a year that we got a second one for the laundry room. I actually prefer the ORB because the stainless one shows a few water spots. We turned off the lower motion sensor in the laundry room so I can toss stuff in the sink without setting it off. The ability to wave on and wave off from above the faucet is WONDERFUL in both locations!! Hands oily or covered in flour, or just touched the raw fish? No problem! It was expensive for sure but quality seems great and convenience factor is the best.
customer_reviews.author: Tim J Talbert

customer_reviews.title: Low flowing - there is no fix - do not buy unless you have infinite patience
customer_reviews.text: I have worked with Moen customer service, and they are very good. After cleaning, then entirely removing the built in filter, AND installing a new high flow head Moen sent me ( for free - thank you)... the water still flows far too slow for anything other than filling a glass of water. It takes about 9 to 10 seconds to fill a 16 ounce glass. We use the kitchen faucet for other tasks such as filling mop buckets and replacing aquarium water by the gallon. At nearly a minute and a half per gallon, it is truly an aggravation to use. I will have to replace this faucet even though it is only a few months old.
customer_reviews.author: Magic Biddie

customer_reviews.title: Ghost in the house
customer_reviews.text: We have had this for about two years. It was mostly ok for the first year with only what we thought were random ons and offs. (Us in another room and all of a sudden the water turns on) As of the past 6 months....This little darlin has become alive. Yes...Alive. It likes water "on" a lot. It likes water "on" during the day, during the night and even while we are standing there watching. For awhile, we would just put it in the corner...sorta like Time Out...but it has figured out how to "water on" even in the corner now. Yesterday, we had an exorcism. The beast is gone. We will be checking our water bill monthly for awhile.
customer_reviews.author: Ripleey

customer_reviews.title: Works well as long as you use the battery pack.
customer_reviews.text: So we purchased this and used an AC plug. It worked perfectly when I had it plugged in with batteries. As soon as I used the AC it would go off randomly throughout the day. I ended up purchasing rechargeable batteries so that we can just switch them out and not run up a big bill on batteries. They seem to last about a month in our house before they go.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: 1st amazon was awesome- ordered in late afternoon friday had by 12:00 next day
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful faucet. Very easy to install. Love the fact it has an aerated faucet and a spray and they can both get power boost. was listed on Moen for @ $500.00, Amazon had for $244.00-awesome. Only dislike is was hoping hose would reach to stove to fill large pots, which means the hose would have to be @ 93"+ instead of 68". Another option would be to be able to purchase a longer hose, also not an option at this time.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce M. Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Motion-Sensing Faucet not really worthwhile for home use
customer_reviews.text: Moen makes the best, most reliable plumbing products in our experience. Our remodeled kitchen has two sinks. We bought a regular Moen faucet for one sink and an identical appearing motion-sensing faucet for the other. We have used these for a year and both work perfectly. However, we concluded that while a motion-sensing faucet is great for a busy public restroom, its use at home is not worth the extra cost. There is even a small annoyance of having the faucet come on inadevertently, such as when you are simply trying to put an item in the sink.
customer_reviews.author: RAM

customer_reviews.title: Love this faucet!
customer_reviews.text: I am so glad I went for quality this time I replaced my kitchen faucet. It is so much better than what I had before. I love the auto sensor to turn on and off water so you don't touch the handle when you have been handling food that could transfer bacteria. Highly recommend this. And the installation I purchased from Amazon was great. The plumber had to but out my other faucet that had rusted due to leak in the sprayer that we were not aware of until it had done damage. The charge for installation was less than I would have had to pay plumbers I work with already in my real estate business.
customer_reviews.author: LasVegasKarenS

customer_reviews.title: No water if controller breaks
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in the faucet. Goes throws batteries fast. After 1 year it just stopped working. When I called Moen to trouble shoot I was given a week call back appointment. The worse part is that when the faucet controller stops working the water stops flowing. There is no way to work it like an old fashion faucet.
customer_reviews.author: JDean

customer_reviews.title: Another 5 star to 1 star after only one year....
customer_reviews.text: We bought the more expensive Moen faucet thinking it would last a long time. ONE YEAR LATER, both the faucet handle assembly is loose and rattling (no apparent way to tighten) and the faucet gooseneck is also loose with about an 1/8" vertical play (will not stay in position). I am so disgusted at this overpriced Moen junk! Update: Pulled the handle and found all the internals rattling around inside the housing - no adjustment. What an expensive piece of crap!
customer_reviews.author: Navy Vet

customer_reviews.title: Installation was a breeze.
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this six stars I would strictly for installation! I have purchased faucets before from Home Depot and Lowes and they were either missing parts or didn't quite work as expected, but then I found out it's due to politics and keeping prices down. Not this time, all parts were there and the included tool even helped when removing the old faucet. I didn't even need to make an extra trip to Home Depot! And remember...hard water destroys faucets. Keep up on maintenance, cleaning and rebuild kits so you don't end up like those one and two start reviewers ignorant and irritated because they don't know how real life works.
customer_reviews.author: JRocket

customer_reviews.title: Works well enough, but...
customer_reviews.text: First, the instructions are a bit cryptic. Second, one of the water lines going into the base of the faucet was loose. I tightened it as well as I could, since there is no wrench access. So far, so good there. Finally, the bronze finish on the curved tube does not match the base or nozzle. I expect better for a nearly $300 faucet!
customer_reviews.author: Rational

customer_reviews.title: Adhesive on faucet head is peeling off and handle has come off twice.
customer_reviews.text: For the money, this should be a much better built faucet. There is a clear adhesive on the faucet head that is slowly peeling off and revealing a lighter stainless color underneath. Additionally, the handle has fallen off twice and the second time it chipped my porcelain sink. What gives with the garbage being produced these days?
customer_reviews.author: Alex Mastrangeli

customer_reviews.title: An Empowering Kitchen Faucet!
customer_reviews.text: The faucet will turn the water on or off when your hand gets near the sensor. Now, in this age of high stress and Carona Virus, for a brief moment at least, this faucet makes you feel like Master Yoda! OK, you cannot move heavy objects with the power of your mind - but you can turn the water ON and OFF with simply a wave of your hand.
customer_reviews.author: Ted Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Saves time and water!
customer_reviews.text: I didn’t realize how often I have had to turn the faucet on and off until I installed this. I love this!! It saves me so much time when I’m washing dishes and I’m saving water too by not having to take an extra couple of seconds to turn the water off and on every time I need to rinse something. The motion sensor is very sensitive and I’ve never had a problem with it not seeing the wave of my hand. The pull down sprayer has a long enough hose to reach my farmhouse sink and it retracts itself. I’ve had this installed for two months and there is. It one thing I can find to dislike about it.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy S.

customer_reviews.title: Water flow too restricted
customer_reviews.text: Looks 10 dance 3. Nowhere close to the water pressure of the Grohe it replaced. Plumber said there as no way to remove restrictor. UPDATE: Called Moen all of their faucets have a flow rate of 1.75 and there is nothing that can be done about it. Find out the flow rate before buying. Caveat emptor, my last Moen kitchen faucet
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful shaped faucet- however the middle section of the faucet ...
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful shaped faucet- however the middle section of the faucet is a coco brown and the base and spray nozzle is a oil rubbed bronze color. I re-ordered hoping the first one I received was a defective however the second one arrived with the two different colors. Bummer because I really like the shape. Moen needs a better QC person, this product should have need gone out.
customer_reviews.author: The Moglet Ranch

customer_reviews.title: Very cheaply made for the HIGH price
customer_reviews.text: Plastic and awful quality. Plastic clip on control box broke off on first installation. Would have returned, but it was installed. I would think for $290.00 it would not be a piece of junk plastic. VERY disappointed. Will not go back to docked position which would mean do silver is showing in the picture above. You have to manually put it in position. Also, if the batteries go dead your water does not work. Nowhere in the description of the item on Amazon does it say this that I see. If I had it to do over again I would not purchase this Moen faucet. I feel robbed.What a piece of JUNK!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sam M. from WIsconsin

customer_reviews.title: Pretty but Weak Water Flow
customer_reviews.text: We were so excited to buy this faucet and have it installed in the kitchen sink. But once we turned it on, the water flow is so weak, it was an immediate disappointment. I asked the plumber what we could do and he said this is the way these faucets work. And when we were at a friends new house they had the same faucet and it worked as dismally as ours. If I had an alternative at the time of installation I would've sent it back. But we have it today, and I'm continually disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: William Carlin

customer_reviews.title: Top Shelf Faucet!
customer_reviews.text: As most people know, the brand alone (Moen) reflects top quality. This particular faucet, however, takes it a level higher given the sensor, which we find ourselves using much more than anticipated because it is so easy and convenient. The brushed stainless steel also blends in perfectly with all of our new stainless steel appliances.
customer_reviews.author: DonCro2

customer_reviews.title: Most unreliable faucet ever purchases
customer_reviews.text: This unit was installed by licensed plumber and within 9 months started having issues. Would intermittently stop sensing to turn on. After a couple weeks of that it just would not work, no water output at all. Called product support and they said they would mail out two replacement parts, sensor and battery pack. After 6 weeks both parts finally arrived only to not be the problem when replaced. Going on 6-7 weeks with no kitchen faucet! Maybe not a good idea to purchase a high tech expensive unit!
customer_reviews.author: morrison

customer_reviews.title: Start Leaking after one month!
customer_reviews.text: Installed by a plumber in March 2019. Looks great, worked fine for a month. Then noticed water was leaking from the handle and kitchen sink cabinet was soaked. Checked all the hoses and found no leaks. Have to take it apart and realized it was the hose inside the faucet body was leaking. $200 went down the drain. This is not acceptable.
customer_reviews.author: Honda NSX

customer_reviews.title: Handle loose after 1 year.  See video.
customer_reviews.text: Fairly happy with faucet, but handle is already coming loose and won't stay in place so water can go to extreme hot or flop to cold unless you keep hand on it or move it into place just right. The removable end with sprayer is very nice.
customer_reviews.author: flower

customer_reviews.title: wow way easier to install than the Delta Touch2o
customer_reviews.text: I originally went with the Delta Touch2o, but unfortunately I could never get it to work right as my stainless steel sink gave the electrical a lot of issues. Instead of getting the problematic Kohler, I went with the Moen even though I can't say I love the looks of this faucet. Still I am glad I made the switch as the install is way easier than the Delta, it also works!!! I got this done within one hour while the Delta took me 4 hours as the Delta require you to feed all the water lines in from the top where the Moen one goes from the bottom control box.
customer_reviews.author: tm

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money, it malfunctioned after 3 months
customer_reviews.text: A few days ago and Less than 4 months after installing this device, it started to malfunction. I followed instructions to the T for troubleshooting but no luck. It's no longer letting water through and sometimes at night I would hear the water pooring. I am without words and sooo disappointed. I now need to purchase a replacement. A waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Ernie

customer_reviews.title: It is as advertised
customer_reviews.text: We've really enjoyed our new faucet. It has worked great with only a small learning curve. The set up was fairly easy depending on how cluttered under you sink is. I would suggest the electric adapter to avoid getting under your sink to change batteries or mounting the batter pack right inside your doors if you can...plenty of wire. You will need an outlet that is NOT switched under your sink for the adapter.
customer_reviews.author: South40

customer_reviews.title: Best Ever!
customer_reviews.text: This is the Best Faucet ever! This was the third one we installed this year and it wonderful. It works great with two motion sensors and is truly touch-less. We wash our hands soon often these days. It has stopped us from getting water all over the granite counters. The hard water was so hard to get off and I couldn't get the boys to dry it off every time they washed their hands. Only the sinks get wet! No power outlet needed, uses batteries included.
customer_reviews.author: L. C. Brown

customer_reviews.title: It’s super annoying
customer_reviews.text: To be honest, I can’t stand this faucet. The sensor on the side is so sensitive that it will just come on when I’m not trying to get wet. It’s the most annoying thing I have in my house and a lot of guests agree. The faucet itself is beautiful, but there’s no way to turn the front sensor off. I do not recommend this as I think it will drive many of you crazy. If I could exchange it for another Moen faucet I would.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley R.

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY WITH SENSORS
customer_reviews.text: The sensors went out on my faucet in less than 2 years. It would turn on and off randomly non-stop. Moen sent a new black box that they told me would fix it and that cost $200 to put in and it did not fix the issue. Then, month later continued to go on and off continuously. Finally, I just asked for faucet with no sensors, which is half the price. However, now I have a long wait to receive it an and no water in my kitchen sink. It is terrible! I wish i never bought this product, so much money and effort wasted on sensors that do not work!
customer_reviews.author: PATEL FAMILY

customer_reviews.title: Appears even minor debris clogs internal workings of the head.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased the Moen 7594SRS in June 2018. The unit has performed well for about 8 months... Recently the water flow has dropped off significantly. I removed the head as stated by Moen and cleaned minor debris from the strainer. Within the 9th month the flow has deminished enough that the toggle to go from stream to wide spray doesn’t always engage. I called Moen and they are sending a replacement head. I feel compelled to reduce my review since others have / experiencing this flow reduction... I appreciate that Moen is supporting their lifetime warranty, however, the designs seems to need refinement.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Handle design not so good
customer_reviews.text: For the first few months we loved everything about this faucet. Gradually, the handle kept getting looser and looser till it finally fell off. The company sent us a new handle, but it did the same thing after a few months.
customer_reviews.author: Shelly D

customer_reviews.title: After 6 months the sensors started acting up. Now the water will not come on at all.
customer_reviews.text: After six months, the sensors started acting up. We reset them as instructions dictated, and they worked again for about a month. Now the water will not come on at all. We have reset the sensors several times, but the problem remains unfixed. No water. Moen's customer service is slow to respond. When they charge as much as they do for their product, they should have someone working seven days a week, including holidays.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great but a couple of small problems
customer_reviews.text: Really like this faucet. Installed by a plumber. Have had it for 2 months and have not had to replace the battery yet. Even my husband loves it although he didn't see the necessity of getting one. It does give a drip or two after it is turned off. I've come to expect that. My biggest problem is with the lower pot sensor. I can never tell just where the area is that turns it on so when I'm cleaning the sink, it will come on and soak my arm until I move. My solution, either turn off the lower sensor or I try to remember to move it to the side I'm not cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy Davis

customer_reviews.title: Great faucet for the money!
customer_reviews.text: Love love love the way this looks in my kitchen. We have a 130 year old farmhouse and most of our hardware (door knobs, hinges, cabinet hardware) is antique bronze. This fits in perfectly. I was able to install this pretty quickly myself, just needed my husband to hold the faucet above the counter when I was tightening it down. It's been installed for about 2 months now and we've had no issues with leaking out anything else. I just wish we'd installed it sooner!
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Meppelink

customer_reviews.title: High quality, function, warranty
customer_reviews.text: The second faucet was for the island. Salads, juicing, blending,etc. I tried some other 2 handle types. This made sense and it blends in ... with teak floors, walnut cabinets, dark brazilian granite, black composite sinks, slate appliances. Flow is satisfactory. In the 31" sink large area covered and easy to keep clean.
customer_reviews.author: Woofbark... woof

customer_reviews.title: Good product....
customer_reviews.text: It is easy to install, it took me about 20-25 minutes at the most. It is helpful to have additional light under the sink while you install the faucet. Moen is a good product, I have used them for over 12 years. Moen includes a plastic wrench to install the faucet which is very helpful. I know some people will say that the plastic cone(which costs extra) to cover the faucet is unnecessary, but with dishwasher lines and other plumbing fixtures the plastic cone prevents the faucet spray nozzle from hooking on anything.
customer_reviews.author: CNSTF

customer_reviews.title: Too much plastic!!
customer_reviews.text: One of the reasons I went with Moen instead of replacing my current faucet is that the current faucet spray head had too many plastic parts that broke quickly. At least the head body was metal. This one is all plastic!! How is that built to last. For this much money it should have been metal especially since it is one of the most handled of the faucet parts. I will update after installation and use but this was really disappointing. Wonder how much they saved on unit cost? Hope it was worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Hutch White

customer_reviews.title: Frustrating
customer_reviews.text: We bought this two years ago. We have regretted the purchase. It is very sensitive and turns on when I just stand in front of the sink. Sometimes it just runs water without any reason. NowI it has stopped working. I tried changing the batteries and nothing. I'm not handy so It's the plumber at $$$. I may just get a new faucet.
customer_reviews.author: SMS

customer_reviews.title: Faucet that makes a Good Splash
customer_reviews.text: We had this faucet installed by a plumber. Fairly easy to install. Works great. Stream and spray work nicely and the pressure booster is nice to have and easy to use. We would purchase again were we in need of an additional kitchen faucet.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy B

customer_reviews.title: Great faucet
customer_reviews.text: Our old pull down kitchen faucet had started leaking. We decided to replace it with a new motion sense type unit. Order Moen faucet after reading all the reviews. I am an engineer so I follow directions when available. Removed old faucet. Followed directions and installed new faucet. Took approximately 2 hours with help from my 5 year old grandson. Works great and we could not be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Fix

customer_reviews.title: Stylish but not operational
customer_reviews.text: Love the design of the faucet and the aesthetics but stopped working after 1 week. Electrician and Plumber twice unable to fix. Suspect the sensors are bad. Would like to return to Amazon. Changed the faucet to Kohler Barossa which works great. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Bear's Fan

customer_reviews.title: Good looking faucet
customer_reviews.text: Works great so far. Had installed for about 2 weeks. Location of the sensor sometimes causes me to inadvertently activate faucet but very infrequently. It did come one by itself one time and scared the crap out of me and my wife. The finish is great and I’m quite pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander S.

customer_reviews.title: Great design, reasonably easy to install
customer_reviews.text: The motion detection is awesome. The front detector senses when something is beneath the faucet and turns water on, then shuts water off when the item is removed. NOTE: Does not work on clear glass items. The first wave of a hand above the top detector turns the water on continuous, and a second wave turns the water off. NOTE: There is a time limit for continuous running (a few minutes) to prevent overflow. The only item from a design perspective is the temperature control is "front-to-back" (all the way back/straight up is all hot and all the way forward/straight outward is all cold) versus a typical side-to-side configuration on the handle for temperature.
customer_reviews.author: rct1964

customer_reviews.title: I bought this to replace my most annoying pull down faucet that wouldn't stay nested properly in ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace my most annoying pull down faucet that wouldn't stay nested properly in the spout. It is loads better! My hubby installed in in about 30 minutes and I love the graceful look, and how well it matches the instant hot water heater fixture I have installed next to it. What seems a little strange is that the hot water position is with the handle straight up and you pull it toward you for cold...but if that were to bother you, you could switch hoses, I suppose. The old one was such an annoyance, I have to smile every time I use the new one!
customer_reviews.author: katydid

customer_reviews.title: Two-month lifespan
customer_reviews.text: H have the faucet + power adapter. It was working very well for past two months. Now neither sensor is responsive to motion and the faucet engages itself randomly every minute. The faucet HAS TO BE POWERED to operate -- even via the handle. So I currently have to plug it in to use it, then unplug it to stop it from triggering randomly. I'm still under warranty for "parts", but that does not include installation of these parts. Looking forward to ripping this out and installing new parts every two months!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Motion detection or just detects a surface?
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure this detects motion, or if it just detects some kind of reflection, but it works great except on dark surfaces (which kinda makes me think it uses reflection). It does take a fraction of a second to come on and another fraction to turn off, so we keep a pot underneath to catch the half-second of extra flow, just on principle. This was a splurge for us and is great for cooking with frequent hand washing. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: C. Grant

customer_reviews.title: Bad packaging
customer_reviews.text: This box came with no outer packaging.... the box itself was not taped shut.... we were surprised the parts were still in it..... sending back.... hot water hose must be clogged.... we were not getting any hot water.... had to go out to get a new faucet couldn’t wait for this to get exchanged.... very disappointed! Installed a different faucet and it worked just fine
customer_reviews.author: karen  g

customer_reviews.title: Handle has come loose... and it's touchless
customer_reviews.text: I've had this faucet for just over a year and the handle has come loose. I'm not sure how this happened as we hardly ever use the handle bc it's touchless. We've looked at how to fix it and also looked in the instruction booklet and nothing is mentioned about how to repair a loose handle. After paying over $300, I think it's poor design since we rarely use the handle and there's no way of tightening it. Bummed :(
customer_reviews.author: Todd Osborne

customer_reviews.title: Plastic City
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful design but really cheap. The sprayer attachment to the faucet is plastic. In other words, you're going to be pulling on plastic every time you pull the sprayer out. The water lines are flimsy and cheap. If I wanted to get something cheap I would have spent $100 less. Don't know what happened to Moen? Seems like a race to the bottom.
customer_reviews.author: chris100

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Well made and easy to install (as ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Well made and easy to install (as easy as anything can be on your back under a sink). The sensors are "sensitive" which is good, but it will get you wet if you are not paying attentional and cleaning around the sink. Steam (interestingly enough) will also set them off, but that is more amusing than troublesome. Suggest that anyone getting one of these purchases the A/C adapter. The battery pac works fine, but typically there is a spare outlet under the sink. If not, then your choice is made for you, but the A/C adapter is a much better option long term.
customer_reviews.author: troconn the destroyer

customer_reviews.title: Best Part Of My Whole House
customer_reviews.text: I'm obsessed with this faucet. I'm a plumber and I put this in a couple years ago and it's a game changer. Dealing in raw meat is one of the main reasons I love it. Juggling trying to get a faucet on after working with raw meat is a pain. I've had no issues with it except having to change the batteries. Moen has a lifetime warranty on their products. Anytime I've ever had an issue with something, I call and no questions ask they send you parts and walk you through fixing it. Can't ask for better service.
customer_reviews.author: TJ Taraszka

customer_reviews.title: Leaked
customer_reviews.text: The client service is excellent! But within one year this had to be replaced. They replaced it without hesitation. Then approximately 7-10 months later, we had the same problem. There is a nut or bolt in the handle that loosens and the water leaks out the handle. It was such a small leak initially, that we didn't catch it. It caused water damage to our brand new cabinets under the sink. Our kitchen is only 2.5 years old and it has been replaced once and fixed once. If it had to start over, I would definitely buy from Moen, just not this faucet.
customer_reviews.author: Waynonda

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I am trying to install this faucet to my new kitchen in Mexico. Our hidraulic system is completely different and we have had to adapt the hoses. A complete mess. Paid a very high price and it doesn't provide the right tools to install it. Also, I could not find a traditional faucet instead of the pull out one. The motionless system is nor working either. I have used moen products before since I have ahotel but this piece is very complicated Sending it back will be too expensive
customer_reviews.author: Cliente de Amazon

customer_reviews.title: Moen makes great products
customer_reviews.text: We replaced Moen faucet without pull down sprayer because water splashed/spattered in bottom of sink. Water pressure probably too high. Didn't think we would like a pull-down sprayer - - but we love it - and it did solve the splashing issue as it. Pretty easy install (and I am 76), but must lay down under sink. Comes with required faucet install wrench.
customer_reviews.author: David Steele

customer_reviews.title: Hands Free
customer_reviews.text: I had wanted a "hands free" faucet for a long time. The purchase and remodel of a home gave me the perfect opportunity. I love this faucet. I was concerned it would be too modern for our farm house decor but it goes great with the kitchen. I love being able to turn the water on without touching anything with my messy hands. So far no issues with sensor not responding or coming on by itself which was in some of the reviews I had read. Buying it on Amazon was much more economical than buying it at the local big name store I would normally purchase from.
customer_reviews.author: Stormey P

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this faucet so much!!!!
customer_reviews.text: We have had this faucet for about 2 months now and I couldn't be happier. LOVE it. The main faucets swivels nicely and temperature control is great. Love the nozzle which is spray or a nice steady flow. What I love most is the touchless feature. The sensor near the base goes on for 10 seconds or so if you wave your hand in front of it. thats nice it you just want to wet a paper towel or just rinse your hands. The top sensor will stay on until you wave your hand over it to it LOVE this faucet. Worth the money. Would definitely buy again. Modern looking without being too modern.
customer_reviews.author: Karl Solivan

customer_reviews.title: Mad as hell
customer_reviews.text: I bought one from lowes STORE and it works great but This one From AMAZON is not working. I literally have to turn. my Faucet OFF to keep sensors from coming on by itself. I cant remove it because its $250 to install, Im a disabled veteran and disgusted with this particular Faucet 😤😤
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: So many out there with horrible reviews.  This one works well with great water pressure.
customer_reviews.text: Glad to discover this is the same one my plumber has in his kitchen, though I didn't know that until he arrived for the install. Spray head re-seats itself beautifully, the power spray setting works and it resets itself to regular faucet setting when put away. Swivels incredibly well and doesn't splash the kitchen up. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Bo3b

product_meta.title: Moen 7594ESRS Arbor Motionsense Two-Sensor Touchless One-Handle Pulldown Kitchen Faucet Featuring Power Clean, Spot Resist Stainless
product_meta.description:
Color:Spot Resist Stainless| Style:2-Sensor| Pattern Name:Kitchen FaucetThe Arbor pulldown kitchen faucet with MotionSense provides the convenience of having a kitchen faucet that can literally sense what you're trying to accomplish and respond to what you need, the moment you need it. That's because MotionSense activates flow based on simple hand movements. This convenient, hands free control assists in accomplishing routine tasks with greater Speed and efficiency. MotionSense delivers convenience on command.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
MotionSense provides the convenience of having a kitchen faucet that can literally sense what you're trying to accomplish and respond to what you need, the moment you need it. That's because MotionSense activates flow based on simple hand movements. This convenient, hands–free control assists in accomplishing routine tasks with greater speed and efficiency. MotionSense is now available with the tailored look of our transitionally styled Arbor.
feature_bullets: SPOT RESISTANT: Spot Resist Stainless finish resists fingerprints and water spots for a cleaner looking kitchen
TWO SENSORS: MotionSense delivers exceptional hands-free touchless convenience with double sensors, allowing a simple hand movement to trigger the flow of water
POWER CLEAN: Power Clean spray technology provides 50 percent more spray power versus most of our pulldown and pull-out faucets without the Power Clean technology
RETRACTABLE: Equipped with the Reflex system for smooth operation, easy movement and secure docking of the spray head
FLEXIBLE DESIGN: Designed to be installed through 1 or 3 holes; escutcheon included
BUILT TO LAST: Backed by Moen’s Limited Lifetime Warranty

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
